Entry.Name: Secure Client-Initiated Renegotiation
Entry.Description: Due to an incorrect handling of the Secure Client-Initiated Renegotiation mechanism, an attacker is able to compromise the availability of the service. In particular, by repeatedly requesting a session renegotiation, the attacker is able to saturate the server's resources resulting in a Denial-of-Service.

Mitigation.Textual: Update the TLS library to a version that allows renegotiation disabling (e.g. OpenSSL v1.1.1+)
